features: Potty-train like a hero with PJ Masks Pampers Easy Ups Training Pants
360 stretchy waistband for easy pull up and down
Up to 100% leakproof with Dual Leak-Guard Barriers
Extra Absorb Channels quickly lock wetness away from skin
body.description: Potty-train like a hero with PJ Masks Pampers Easy Ups Training Pants. Featuring your favorite heroes Catboy, Owlette and Gekko, these super soft and comfy training pants fit just like real cotton undies with a 360 stretchy waistband that is gentle on your child’s skin and easy to pull up and down. Plus, they’re dermatologically tested, hypoallergenic, and free of parabens and latex.* That’s just one of the many reasons Pampers is the #1 pediatrician recommended brand. When it comes to potty accidents, your toddler will be covered with up to 100% leakproof protection. To protect where leaks happen most, Easy Ups are made with Dual Leak-Guard Barriers around the leg cuffs while Extra Absorb Channels quickly absorb accidents and lock them away from your toddler's skin. And when it's time to take them off, Easy-Tear Sides make removal and disposal a cinch. Potty-training is a journey and can take your toddler 90 days on average to catch on. So, Pampers Easy Ups makes it easy with each box containing a one-month supply of training pants. Available in sizes 2T–3T (16–34 lb), 3T–4T (30–40 lb), 4T–5T (37+ lb) and 5T– 6T (41+ lb).

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Wish potty training was easier? Give them a choice! Potty training is tough, but here’s a little secret: when you let your child choose, it’s easy. Set up for potty-training success Before potty-training, make sure your toddler is ready by talking with your pediatrician and checking out the info below. Next, start a potty routine after meals and before naps and bedtime. Give your toddler a choice Toddlers love to be involved. You can let them help pick out their training pants at the store, or things like their prizes, potty seat, and where they go at home. A little ownership goes a long way!

Encourage & Reward with Their Favorite Pals Make potty training encouraging and rewarding with sticker charts, high fives and small rewards along the way. Use your toddler’s favorite characters as their potty pals along the journey.

What sizes do Pampers Easy Ups come in? Pampers Easy Ups training underwear come in four sizes: 2T–3T (16–34 lb), 3T–4T (30–40 lb), 4T–5T (37+ lb) and 5T–6T (41+ lb). How do Pampers Easy Ups help prevent leaks? Easy Ups offer the same great Pampers protection you’ve come to love. Extra Absorb Channels protect against leaks, day or night, by locking wetness away from your toddler’s skin. Dual Leak-Guard Barriers also help stop leaks where they happen most. Can I use Easy Ups for nighttime protection? Yes! Pampers Easy Ups provide up to 12 hours of protection to help prevent leaks day and night. Can my son wear Easy Ups with Trolls designs? Can my daughter wear Easy Ups with PJ Masks designs? Yes! Pampers Easy Ups are designed with absorbency to meet both boys’ and girls’ needs, just like diapers. Your toddler can wear either design they choose! Are Easy Ups right for my child? Yes! Easy Ups are specially designed for potty training with our 360° stretchy waistband for a soft, comfortable fit. They look and feel just like real underwear and are easy for your toddler to pull up and down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality training pant
reviews.reviewText: I have used Pampers Easy Ups for both of my kids for many years and I can say that they are the best brand of training pants. They are soft, comfortable, and absorbent. They fit well and do not leak or sag. They are easy to pull up and down and have cute designs. My kids love them and they have helped them transition from diapers to underwear. I highly recommend Pampers Easy Ups to any parent who is looking for a quality training pant.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and Easy for Kids
reviews.reviewText: Potty training is easier with these. No leaks and they still feel the wetness if there is an accident

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Good price for the amount can’t find this deal in storeHolds a lot my toddler drinks a lot of water so it holds up well during the nightAlso easy for him to pull down and pull up without tearing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These pull ups are cute, soft enough not to itch or scratch your potty training Tot's skin, holds in those accidents fairly well and serves it's purpose for overnight peepees lol. I would recommend these pull ups if you're looking for a decent price and quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good pull ups
reviews.reviewText: I have been buying these throughout the years, for my kids, they all liked them and they work quite well. They even are able to hold a good amount of pee, for those times when a kid drink way to much liquids and has a bigger pee than normal.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Price comparable to big box stores
reviews.reviewText: Love the quality of the pull ups and it is priced similarly to the big box stores

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to put on and take off
reviews.reviewText: Very absorbent. My 4 year old can out them on and take them off all by himself no problem. They last all night with no problems

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The first pull-up that hasn’t leaked!
reviews.reviewText: I’m officially in love with these pull-ups for my heavy-wetting 3 year old. We’ve tried A LOT of diapers, slip-ons, and pull-ups. He’s autistic and not exactly ready to fully potty train, but knows how to use his potty. We’ve mainly been working on pulling these off and on so he can get the hang of it before wearing his boxer briefs full time. These aren’t the softest material ever, but similar to other Pampers diapers. I think 360s might be a little softer. Compared to a 360, Easy Ups are a little shorter in height and not as thick… which makes them feel more like underwear. They’re not as short as some training pants that claim to fit like underwear (like Pull-ups brand or Honest Company training pants… those show a lot of plumber booty!).He drinks like a fish, and luckily these hold a ton of liquid! The only time he leaked was when these were too small. I have to size up in order to prevent that. He’s about 36.6 lbs and wears mostly 3T pants, some 4T PJs. The 4T-5T size fits perfectly.I forgot to change him into his night pull-up & booster pad the other night, but it was fine!! No leaks.He prefers these over every other diaper and pull-up he has… and that’s saying a lot for a sensory kiddo!UPDATE: I’m sad to say we had to switch to a Velcro pull-up for my son’s developmental preschool. They prefer velcro so they don’t have to remove his shoes. We found a GREAT alternative that doesn’t itch like normal Pull-Ups… Huggies Pull-Ups New Leaf. Super soft and they have even more absorbency than these!Hope this helps! ☺️
